department: College of Computing and Digital Media
biography: Rick Omanson is a Vice President at GfK Custom Research (a market research and UX  consulting company, formerly User Centric). Prior to joining GfK, Rick was Senior User Interface Designer at Infogix (a financial software company) and Director at iXL (an Internet consulting company, now Razorfish). Prior to his tenure as a consultant, Rick spent 15 years in the telecommunications industry at AT&T Bell Labs (now Alcatel-Lucent) and Ameritech (now AT&T) where he was a systems engineer, software developer, human factors specialist, and Director of Ameritech.net's Web development team.<br><br>Rick received his B.S. in psychology from the University of Illinois at Champaign-Urbana and his Ph.D. in developmental cognitive psychology from the University of Minnesota. He spent five years as a research fellow at the University of Pittsburgh, has three user interface patents, and has published and presented papers in the areas of interface design, artificial intelligence, online learning, reading and vocabulary instruction, and cognitive development. <br>
